title: Additional ner models
body:
- Addition of XLMRoberta model support
- Addition of 4 new models for NER for English, German, Spanish and Dutch
- Minor update to the generation pipeline
- Updated download scripts to be compatible with API changes in Transformers library
- Updated T5 prefix (elimination of trailing whitespace)

title: Fixed generation masking
body:
- Updated generation pipelines masking
- Fixes incorrect generation when batched inputs are passed to the model

title: Updated multi turn conversation
body:
- Updated padding clean-up
- Addition of a minimum response length buffer

title: Generalized qa patch
body:
- Fixed path to BERT_QA
- Addition of RoBERTa pre-trained model for question answering (contributed by [deepset](https://deepset.ai))
- Addition of ALBERT options for sequence classification, token classification and question answering pipelines

title: Question answering generalization
body: - Generalization of the Question Answering pipeline allowing for Roberta and BERT models

title: T5 implementation
body:
- Implementation of the T5 language model
- Update of the translation pipeline to allow using different language models (currently Marian or T5)
- Minor fixes of the documentation

title: Updated tch::nn::Path handling to be consistent across crate
body: Updated modules to use consistent handling of paths following https://github.com/guillaume-be/rust-bert/pull/58

title: Generic path argument
body: It replaces `p: &nn::Path<'p>` arguments with `p: P` where `P: Borrow<nn::Path<'p>>` such that the argument accepts both owned or borrowed type. It avoids wrapping around the brackets like `&(p / "name")`.

title: Multiturn conversation
body:
- Addition of support for [DialoGPT](https://github.com/microsoft/DialoGPT)
- Addition of pipeline for multi-turn dialogue systems
- Addition of Conversation & ConversationManager to handle multiple conversations in a single model

title: Code formatting
body:
- Updated code formatting to use rustfmt
- Updated CI to include formatting checks

title: Albert implementation
body: - Implementation of the ALBERT language model

title: Addition of BART finetuned on XSum dataset
Non mutable generation
body:
- Updated generation pipeline to be non mutable
- Updated BART cache to be an input/output rather than a model internal variable

title: Translation update
body:
- Fixed translation & summarization padding
- Addition of English <-> Russian translation model

title: Marian implementation
body:
- Implementation of the MarianMT model
- Implementation of translation pipeline, supporting the following language pairs:
  - English <-> French
  - English <-> Spanish
  - English <-> Portuguese
  - English <-> Italian
  - English <-> Catalan
  - English <-> German
  - French <-> German

title: Creation of local runtime for async resource download
Addition of multi-label classification prediction method for sequence…
Qa optimization
body:
- Constant batch size for question answering
- Order of predictions respecting input order

title: Updated QA allowing for long contexts
body: - Updated QA script to allow for context where features generated exceed batch length

title: Token entity parsing
body:
- Consolidation of sub tokens for token classification task
- Label aggregation across sub tokens
- Tokens reference original sentence text (allows reconstruction of destructive tokenization steps, e.g. lowercasing)

title: Adapted to API changes in offset-aware rust-tokenizer
body:
This is a small PR that does the fixes some calls to be compatible with the offset-aware API in rust-tokenizer. (guillaume-be/rust-tokenizers#14 & guillaume-be/rust-tokenizers#19) 

There's still a little thing to fix I realized, probably in the tokenizers, because now some openai_gpt tests fail now, all on  the token "i\'m". 

```

failures:

---- openai_gpt_generation_beam_search stdout ----
thread 'openai_gpt_generation_beam_search' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `"the dog isn\'t going anywhere. i\'m going to take care of him. i \'ll be right"`,
 right: `"the dog isn\'t going anywhere. i \'m going to take care of him. i \'ll be right"`', tests/openai_gpt.rs:128:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

---- openai_gpt_generation_greedy stdout ----
thread 'openai_gpt_generation_greedy' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `"it was an intense machine dialogue. \n \" i\'m sorry, but we have to go now! the police are on their way and they\'re going after you - or at least that\'s what my"`,
 right: `"it was an intense machine dialogue. \n \" i \'m sorry, but we have to go now! the police are on their way and they\'re going after you - or at least that\'s what my"`', tests/openai_gpt.rs:96:5

---- openai_gpt_generation_beam_search_multiple_prompts_without_padding stdout ----
thread 'openai_gpt_generation_beam_search_multiple_prompts_without_padding' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `"the dog isn\'t going anywhere. i\'m going to take care of him. i \'ll be right"`,
 right: `"the dog isn\'t going anywhere. i \'m going to take care of him. i \'ll be right"`', tests/openai_gpt.rs:165:5


failures:
    openai_gpt_generation_beam_search
    openai_gpt_generation_beam_search_multiple_prompts_without_padding
    openai_gpt_generation_greedy
```

title: Generic sequence classification
body:
- Addition of generic sequence classification (mirroring the generic token classification)
- Move of shared generic components to a common module
- Addition of Electra to the list of available models

title: More generic token classification pipeline supporting multiple models
body:
Salut @guillaume-be! 

*Pour commencer, merci beaucoup pour ce logiciel formidable que tu as crée!*

This draft pull request contains my attempt to build a more generic token classification pipeline. I realized that your NER pipeline (``src/pipelines/ner.rs``) was hard coded to use Bert (with the conll03 models hard-coded as well) but I am in need of something more flexible/generic that can accommodate all token classification models you implemented (bert, roberta, distilbert) and with whatever tokenizer/config configuration they are suited for. I felt such a pipeline would fit best in rust-bert itself.  Would you be open to such a contribution?

What I did is the following:
 * I started with a copy of your ``ner.rs``, but moved away from all the NER-centric naming as all this serves PoS tagging and other uses just as well. The idea is that ``token_classification.rs`` could eventually replace ``ner.rs`` if you agree; for now I implemented it as an independent copy though.
 * I built an abstractions interface over various ``*Configs``, ``*Tokenizers`` and ``*ForTokenClassification`` models so they can be switched as needed, a kind of polymorphism if you will.
 * The abstractions are currently implemented through enums (``ConfigOption``, ``TokenizerOption`` and ``TokenClassificationOption``) rather than through traits and/or generics, as the latter option would be far more invasive to the rest of the library and things could get fairly complicated quickly. I wonder what your view is on this?
 * I created one ``TokenClassificationModel`` (my adaptation of your ``NERModel``) which now works with the above abstracted interfaces. (``TokenClassificationConfiguration`` is the adaptation of your ``NERConfig``)

Most of the work can also be applied to the other pipelines I think, but I haven't gone there yet, it will require some further reorganization probably.

By the way, I'm working on a CLI tool that is using your library (with my changes) to make available various NLP pipelines (and eventually more) for end-users: https://github.com/proycon/deepfrog (pre-alpha!).

**Note:** *this is a draft pull request, it's not ready for merge yet even though 'it works', I might still tweak some stuff but I wanted to already open the discussion to see if you were open to such new features and to hear any input you may have*

title: Updated dependencies to use latest tokenization crate version
body:
- Updated `rust_tokenizers` dependency to 2.0.5
- Updated `tch-rs` dependnecy to 0.1.7

title: Electra implementation
body: - Implementation of Electra (generator and discriminator)
